blog.title: **Latest** Articles
blog.subtitle: *Thoughts*, tutorials, and insights about **web development**
blog.description: Articles and guides on **frontend**, **design**, **UX** and workflow. Blog posts you can read today and use today: less textbook theory, more real-world examples, architecture decisions and small hacks that make your daily **code** life easier.
blog.pageDescription:
This blog is where I unpack what I use every day: **frontend**, **TypeScript**, **Astro**, **React**, **UX**, **code** architecture and workflows. You won't find textbook theory here, but real examples, design decisions and lessons learned from both personal products and client projects.

The idea is simple: share the kind of content I wish I had before running into certain problems. Less fluff, more context, practical best practices and enough detail so you can walk away from each post with something you can actually apply.

cta.title: Want to learn more?
cta.description: Subscribe to get notified about new articles

post1.title: Getting Started with Astro and React
post1.excerpt: Learn how to combine Astro's static site generation with React's component model for the best of both worlds.

post2.title: Building Animations with GSAP
post2.excerpt: A comprehensive guide to creating smooth, professional animations using GreenSock Animation Platform.

post3.title: Dark Mode Implementation Guide
post3.excerpt: Step-by-step tutorial on implementing dark mode with Tailwind CSS and proper state persistence.

about.title: About **Me**
about.subtitle: Get to know me through *code*
about.storyParagraph1: I'm a **developer** with over *20 years* of professional experience, but the story started much earlier. I was around 8 or 9 when I wrote my first lines of code. I focus on **web development**, with a strong love for **frontend**, where code meets design and user experience. I can handle backend too, but I feel at home making interfaces that connect with people.
about.storyParagraph2: I also have a background in **graphic design**, which sharpened my visual sense and communication skills. I'm **self-taught** and *endlessly curious*, the kind of person who learns by exploring, breaking things, and fixing them better. I genuinely love *technology*. I can spend hours coding, experimenting, and building new ideas.
about.storyParagraph3: Born in **1980**, I've witnessed the evolution of computing from the pre PC days to today's *AI-driven* world. Off-screen, I'm happily in a relationship and a father of two amazing young adults.
about.storySummary: In short: a lifelong learner who codes with **purpose**, designs with *intent*, and never stops being **curious**.

beginning.title: My Journey
beginning.description: A journey through my professional evolution and most important milestones.

present.title: What's next?
present.description: The journey continues. Always looking for new challenges and opportunities to grow.

testimonials.title: What People Say

branding.title: Qazuor
branding.description:
I'm a **full-stack** developer with a strong **frontend** focus, dedicated to building modern, fast and accessible web experiences.

I help companies and entrepreneurs turn ideas into **clear digital products**, combining clean **code**, solid **design** and decisions made with scaling in mind. Whether you need a complete web app, a high-converting landing page, or performance optimization, I bring both technical depth and an eye for user experience.

tools.title: Tools
tools.subtitle: Interactive tools and utilities
tools.pageDescription: Small **tools** built for everyday development: generators, helpers and utilities that simplify repetitive tasks. If something saves me time or reduces mistakes when writing **code**, it usually becomes a tool and ends up documented here.

snippets.title: Snippets
snippets.subtitle: Ready-to-use code snippets
snippets.pageDescription: Ready-to-use **code** fragments you can copy, adapt and paste: **React** patterns, **TypeScript** helpers, **frontend** logic and functions I reuse constantly. The goal is to have an organized place to find quick solutions without reinventing the wheel every time.

cssTricks.title: CSS Tricks
cssTricks.subtitle: Quick CSS tips and techniques
cssTricks.pageDescription: Small **CSS** tricks to handle interface details: layouts, subtle effects, simple animations and micro-interactions. These examples are meant to make it easy to grasp the pattern, adapt it to your design and keep your visual **code** clean and consistent.

usefulLinks.title: Useful Links
usefulLinks.subtitle: Curated resources for developers
usefulLinks.pageDescription: A curated selection of **links** I actually use: solid documentation, design references, **frontend** resources and online tools that make daily work easier. Less noise, more sites that add real value when you're building something serious.

faqs.title: **Frequently** Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: Answers to common questions about working with me
faqs.description: Whether you're a potential client looking to build a project or an employer exploring collaboration options, here are answers to questions I get asked most often.

clients.question: How long does a typical project take?
clients.answer: Timelines vary based on project scope. A landing page typically takes 1-2 weeks, while a full web application can take 4-12 weeks. I'll provide a detailed timeline during our initial consultation after understanding your specific requirements.

clients.question: What technologies do you work with?
clients.answer: I specialize in modern web technologies: React, TypeScript, Astro, and Tailwind CSS for frontend, with Node.js, Hono, and PostgreSQL for backend needs. I choose the best stack for each project based on requirements, scalability needs, and long-term maintainability.

clients.question: What types of clients do you work with?
clients.answer: I work with startups, small businesses, agencies, and individual entrepreneurs. Whether you need a portfolio site, a SaaS dashboard, or an e-commerce platform, I adapt my approach to fit your business size and budget while maintaining quality standards.

clients.question: What's your work process like?
clients.answer: I follow a structured process: 1) Discovery call to understand your needs, 2) Proposal with scope and timeline, 3) Design/wireframes approval, 4) Development with regular updates, and 5) Testing and deployment. You'll always know exactly where we stand.

clients.question: Do you provide ongoing support after launch?
clients.answer: Yes! I offer maintenance packages that include bug fixes, security updates, performance monitoring, and minor feature additions. Many clients continue working with me long after launch for continuous improvements and new features.

employers.question: Are you available for full-time positions?
employers.answer: Yes, I'm open to the right full-time remote opportunity. I'm particularly interested in roles where I can contribute to product development, work with modern technologies, and be part of a team that values code quality and user experience.

employers.question: Are you open to part-time or contract work?
employers.answer: Absolutely! I'm available for part-time arrangements, fixed-term contracts, or project-based work. This flexibility allows me to contribute meaningfully to your team while managing other commitments. Let's discuss what arrangement works best for both of us.

employers.question: What's your remote work setup?
employers.answer: I have a fully equipped home office in Argentina (UTC-3) with reliable high-speed internet, professional audio/video equipment for meetings, and experience working asynchronously with teams across different time zones. I'm comfortable with tools like Slack, GitHub, Linear, and Notion.
